summary:
Right now, all the major quantum computing efforts are hardware-constrained—we can't build enough qubits and link them together for error correction to let us do useful calculations. Still, there's a strong case to be made that moving beyond qubits could be valuable: it lets us do a lot more with less hardware. Making ququarts

More complex qudits haven't been as popular with the people who are developing quantum computing hardware for a number of reasons; one of them is simply that some hardware only has access to two possible states.
